units.title: Detach hPSCs for 3D differentiation
units.text: hPSC cells were detached from the culture dish with 0.5 mM Accutase (Thermo Fisher Scientific, #A1110501) to yield a single cell suspension.
units.rationale: This is a clear, actionable step in the protocol for preparing cells for 3D organoid differentiation.

units.title: Initiate 3D VM organoid differentiation
units.text: Differentiation was initiated by plating 2500 single cells in each well of a 96-well U-bottom plate (Corning, #CLS7007) in iPS Brew with 10 µM Y-27632 dihydrochloride (Miltenyi, #130-106-538), as previously described27.
units.rationale: This specifies exact cell number, plate type, medium, and compound used to start differentiation — a key procedural step.

units.title: Transfer embryoid bodies to differentiation medium
units.text: After three days in culture, embryoid bodies were transferred to differentiation medium consisting of 1:1 DMEM/F12:Neurobasal medium (Thermo Fisher Scientific, #21331020 and #A1371201), 1:100 N2 supplement (Thermo Fisher Scientific, #A1370701), 10 µM SB431542 (Miltenyi, #130-106-543), 150 ng/ml rhNoggin (Miltenyi, #130-103-456), 400 ng/ml SHH-C24II (Miltenyi, #130-095-727), and 1.5 µM CHIR99021 (Miltenyi, #130-106-539), and in the presence of 200 mM L-glutamine (Thermo Fisher Scientific, #25030081) and 10,000 U/mL penicillin-streptomycin (Thermo Fisher Scientific, #15140122).
units.rationale: This is a detailed, time-stamped protocol step with exact reagent concentrations and sources, critical for reproducibility.

units.title: Transfer organoids to 24-well plate with maturation factors
units.text: On day 11, developing VM organoids were transferred to a 24-well plate containing 1:50 Neurobasal medium, B27 supplement without vitamin A (Thermo Fisher Scientific, #12587010), and 100 ng/mL FGF-8b (Miltenyi, #130-095-740).
units.rationale: This specifies timing, container, and medium composition for a key maturation phase in organoid development.

units.title: Add BDNF and L-Ascorbic acid on day 14
units.text: On day 14, 20 ng/mL BDNF (Miltenyi, #130-096-286) and 200 µM L-Ascorbic acid (Sigma-Aldrich, #A4403-100MG) were added.
units.rationale: This is a precise, time-dependent addition of factors critical for neuronal maturation in the protocol.

units.title: Embed organoids in Matrigel
units.text: At this point, VM organoids were embedded in 30 µL droplets of Matrigel (BD Biosciences), as previously described27.
units.rationale: This describes a specific, actionable step in organoid maturation involving extracellular matrix embedding.

units.title: Add db-cAMP and DAPT for terminal maturation
units.text: From day 16 onward, 0.5 mM db-cAMP (Sigma-Aldrich, #D0627-1G) and 1 µM DAPT (R&D Systems, #2634) were added to the culture medium for terminal maturation for up to four months.
units.rationale: This defines the long-term maturation protocol with exact compounds and duration, essential for reproducibility.

units.title: Prepare 10x Genomics single-cell RNA-seq libraries
units.text: For 10x Genomics single-cell RNA sequencing, single-cell suspensions were loaded onto 10x Genomics Single Cell 3′ Chips along with the mastermix as per the manufacturer’s protocol (https://support.10xgenomics.com/single-cell-gene-expression/index/doc/technical-note-chromium-single-cell-3-v3-reagent-workflow-and-software-updates) for the Chromium Single Cell 3′ Library to generate single cell gel beads in emulsion (GEMs, version 3 chemistry).
units.rationale: This is a direct, step-by-step instruction for library preparation with reference to manufacturer’s protocol.

units.title: Sequence libraries on NextSeq500 or NovaSeq6000
units.text: The resulting libraries were sequenced on either a NextSeq500 or a NovaSeq 6000 with the following specifications Read1 28 cycles, Read2 98 cycles, and Index1 8 cycles using a 200-cycle kit.
units.rationale: This specifies exact sequencing platform and cycle parameters — critical for technical reproducibility.

units.title: Process raw sequencing data with Cell Ranger
units.text: Raw base calls were demultiplexed and converted fastq files using cellranger mkfastq program (bcl2fastq 2.19/cellranger 3.0). Sequencing data were first preprocessed through the Cell Ranger pipeline (10x Genomics, Cellranger count v2) with default parameters (expect-cells set to the number of cells added to 10x system), aligned to GrCH38 (v3.1.0), and the resulting matrix files were used for subsequent bioinformatic analysis.
units.rationale: This is a verbatim description of the bioinformatic processing pipeline with exact tools and versions, essential for protocol replication.
